name: sympathetically
content:
sympathetically adverb
(UNDERSTANDING)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows you understand and care about someone else's suffering: She listened sympathetically, nodding her head now and again.
If a character in a book or film is shown sympathetically, they are described or shown in such a way that you are able to understand the character's feelings, with the result that you like them: The character is sympthetically portrayed.
More examplesFewer examplesI go up to her and say sympathetically, "You must be very hot and uncomfortable." Towards the end of the book, the authors seem to portray her more sympathetically, as a victim.The sympathetically drawn characters must deal with the types of tragedies every family endures - which makes their story resonate.

sympathetically adverb
(STYLE)
in a style that is suitable, goes well with other things that are in the same place, and considers the feelings and needs of people who use that place: The house has been sympathetically restored.
More examplesFewer examplesAfter a fire in the 1960s the pub was sympathetically restored. Barns can be sympathetically transformed for a range of uses.Windows were replaced with more sympathetically proportioned ones in softwood, painted blue. Concert halls, arts centres or community centres, if sympathetically designed, can be important landmarks.
